intro: Tessaria absinthioides var. ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous wormwood, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
